class_notes: Topics in Environmental Health. EH Department students only; recommended elective that follows EH 501. Class meets 10/20/21-12/7/21. Students must enroll in course as S/U grading status.
course_description: Prereqisite EH 501. EH department students only. Required for GEH and EH students; strongly recommended for EH-EPI students. Introduces students to major topics in environmental health, including mechanisms of toxicity, pesticides and other chemicals, childrenÂ¿s health, water, sanitation, and hygiene, infectious disease, air pollution, climate change, and planetary health. Describes tools used to understand these EH topics, such as exposure science, epidemiology, toxicology, biomarkers/omics, risk assessment, implementation science, and policy. Introduces EH faculty and courses.
prerequisites: This class is for EOHMPH or EOHIHMPH or EOHEPIMPH or EOHEPIMSPH students only.
sections: Class Nbr: 4494, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 10:10a-12p, Instructor: M. Freeman, Status: Open
